content: 2 sts kfb sl1 wyif note that on row 33 you slip 2 sts after the kfb at the start of the row to keep the motifs as symmetrical as possible © ashcroft-hempsall 2022 - for personal non-commercial use only just mosaic it 3 chart 2 work row 41-80 then keep repeating these row until you have just enough yarn left to finish the start and end of the row will be the same you ll just have more repeats in between note you will be slipping 2 sts at start of the row 73 as you did on row 33 of chart 1 finishing - stop after any cc ws row on which you knit the cc sts and slip the mc then work row 81-84 yarn needed reserve at least 3x the length of a row for each of row 81 82 and 83 and 4x the length of the row for row 84 bind-off row row 81 - rs with mc kfb knit to last 2 sts k2tog row 82 - ws with mc sl1 knit to last stitch sl1 no longer increasing on the ws you can work the next 2 row either with the mc creating a band of mc at the bottom edge or with the cc continuing the stripe sequence row 83 repeat row 81 row 84 sl1 wyif then bind off knitwise on ws so that you create with a ridge on the rs not too tightly you might like to use one size larger needle block lightly pinning out the ends to form a boomerang shape see photo and details on page 1 © ashcroft-hempsall 2022 - for personal non-commercial use only
